Documentation.name: UML Profile for INSPIRE data specifications
Documentation.notes: This profile defines a set of stereotypes and tagged values for defining application schemas for INSPIRE data specifications.

Stereotype.name: applicationSchema
Stereotype.notes: An INSPIRE application schema according to ISO 19109 and the Generic Conceptual Model.

Tag.name: targetNamespace
Tag.description: Target XML namespace of the application schema

Tag.name: xmlns
Tag.description: Namespace prefix to be used as short form of the target namespace

Tag.name: version
Tag.description: Current version of the application schema

Tag.name: xsdDocument
Tag.description: Name of an XML Schema document to create representing the content of this package

Tag.name: gmlProfileSchema
Tag.description: URL of the schema location of a GML profile (optional)

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Stereotype.name: leaf
Stereotype.notes: A package that is not an application schema and contains no packages.

Tag.name: inspireConcept
Tag.description: URN reference to the feature concept in the INSPIRE Feature Concept Dictionary Register

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline or by-reference encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: Create a property type that requires that the instance is encoded inline (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the feature type as a feature collection.

Stereotype.name: type
Stereotype.notes: A conceptual, abstract type that is not a spatial object type.

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline or by-reference encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: Create a property type that requires that the instance is encoded inline (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the type as an object collection.

Tag.name: xmlSchemaType
Tag.description: If the type has a canonical XML Schema encoding the XML Schema typename corresponding to the data type shall be given as the value (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule)

Stereotype.name: dataType
Stereotype.notes: A structured data type without identity.

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the data type as an object collection.

Stereotype.name: union
Stereotype.notes: A structured data type without identity where exactly one of the properties of the type is present in any instance.

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always set to false in INSPIRE.

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: asDictionary
Tag.description: Encode code list as externally managed dictionary (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule). Always true in INSPIRE.

Stereotype.name: import
Stereotype.notes: The model elements of the supplier package are imported.

Stereotype.name: voidable
Stereotype.notes: If a characteristic of a spatial object is not present in the spatial data set, but may be present or applicable in the real world, the property shall receive this stereotype. If and only if a property receives this stereotype, the value of void may be used as a value of the property which shall imply that the characteristic is not present in the spatial data set, but may be present or applicable in the real world. It is possible to qualify a value of void in the data with a reason using the VoidValueReason type.

Stereotype.name: lifeCycleInfo
Stereotype.notes: If in an application schema a property is considered to be part of the life-cycle information of a spatial object, the property shall receive this stereotype.

Stereotype.name: version
Stereotype.notes: If in an application schema an association role ends at a spatial object type, this stereotype denotes that the value of the property is meant to be a specific version of the spatial object, not the spatial object in general.

Stereotype.name: placeholder
Stereotype.notes: A type that is not modelled at this time and expected to be modelled by another Annex theme.

Tag.name: inspireConcept
Tag.description: URN reference to the feature concept in the INSPIRE Feature Concept Dictionary Register; optional for placeholders
